Posts.Content: Hello! First sorry about my English. I am estonian and my English is bad But I hope you understand. I am here beacause my father. He is 62. He has been doctors 6 years. They made PSA every year. This summer it was already 4,75. Doctor gave him some antibiotics and PSA was 4,4. Then doctor asked to do biopsy. Week ago he got he`s biopsy results and it was shock all family. They took 8 pieces (or core?) biopsy. 3 was positive. Now I dont know how to translate this text, but 2 pieces have a Gleason score 3+3=6; 1 of them have a perineural infiltration identification (Thats bad? Or what?) In the end is writing that cancer is 9%. Is it T2c or something elseI dont knowhere is no information. Is cancer go more than prostatelymph or boneits so hard to wait the ansver. They didnt do any bone scan. I think its turn out in the surgery. Doctor is very positive and told that dad has a good chance. Next Monday he has prostate surgery. We are so worry, but same time we hope that everything is has to go good. Its so good that I found this site. My English is not good, but something I understand and 2 days I have been reading your stories here Good luck for all!
Posts.Title: First time here

Posts.Content: Thank you for your support and your wishes! Its very good to read your positive stories and it makes feel better! I am not sure about the doctor where my dad is going. I dont know almost anything about him. I know only that the doctor is 61 years old, so he must have some experience if I look hes age, but I am not sure. Also I know that doctor is urologist and surgeon. But he is not oncologist. We have a small country, so I dont know how good health care we have. I cant look another surgeon, because my dad has made decision to go surgery monday. This is the fastest way. Our urolog told that the surgeon is very good. So we have to trust him. I have some questions: 1. When you recovering from your surgery, who was waching you next? Your urologist or some oncologist? And what time after surgery you visit your doctor? How long you had to be hospital after surgery in your country? 2. Did you get some irradiation after surgery? Or doctor made only surgery? Who decide this? 3. How quick they made new PSA test after surgery? Immediately? 4. What mean perineural invasion? Is this bad? May be the tumor can be advanced? They took 8 cores biopsy. 4 left and 4 right side. 3 shows some cancer. 1 right core has G 3+3=6 and perineural invasion symptoms and there is longer text, focus 0,8; 1,4 and 2mm. Something is positive colour? Second core has some little doctor text what I cant translate. There no G score appointed and third core has focus 0,8mm and G 3+3=6 Others are OK. Now I have to make some work so nice day!

My English is not good, but something I understand and 2 days I have been reading your stories here Good luck for all!

Dad is doing really good right now. In the night he dont pee every hour now...maybe 2-3 hours and then. But WHY radiation??? Maybe tomorrow we get answer, but its drives me crazy

Posts.Content: Hello! First sorry about my English. I am estonian and my English is bad But I hope you understand. I am here beacause my father. He is 62. He has been doctors 6 years. They made PSA every year. This summer it was already 4,75. Doctor gave him some antibiotics and PSA was 4,4. Then doctor asked to do biopsy. Week ago he got he`s biopsy results and it was shock all family. They took 8 pieces (or core?) biopsy. 3 was positive. Now I dont know how to translate this text, but 2 pieces have a Gleason score 3+3=6; 1 of them have a perineural infiltration identification (Thats bad? Or what?) In the end is writing that cancer is 9%. Is it T2c or something elseI dont knowhere is no information. Is cancer go more than prostatelymph or boneits so hard to wait the ansver. They didnt do any bone scan. I think its turn out in the surgery. Doctor is very positive and told that dad has a good chance. Next Monday he has prostate surgery. We are so worry, but same time we hope that everything is has to go good. Its so good that I found this site. My English is not good, but something I understand and 2 days I have been reading your stories here Good luck for all!
Posts.Title: First time here

Posts.Content: PDV: Already next day out hospital? Here they hold hospital 10 days! So they told. Or maybe you surgery is different than here? I dont know how they make this? Cut stomach or somehow different? I dont know. HighlanderCFH: Is it possible that my father G is really different than 3+3=6? Beacause the biopsy result was that one core has some perineural invasion. And after that sentence was G 3+3=6. Maybe really its more than 3+3=6? Or how there can be perineural invasion? And actually this word was a little bit different...it wasnt invasion, but "the infiltration". But its so good I find this place. I already can eat and I dont worry so much anymore, because I know that everything goes well
Posts.Title: First time here

Posts.Content: Thank you for your support and your wishes! Its very good to read your positive stories and it makes feel better! I am not sure about the doctor where my dad is going. I dont know almost anything about him. I know only that the doctor is 61 years old, so he must have some experience if I look hes age, but I am not sure. Also I know that doctor is urologist and surgeon. But he is not oncologist. We have a small country, so I dont know how good health care we have. I cant look another surgeon, because my dad has made decision to go surgery monday. This is the fastest way. Our urolog told that the surgeon is very good. So we have to trust him. I have some questions: 1. When you recovering from your surgery, who was waching you next? Your urologist or some oncologist? And what time after surgery you visit your doctor? How long you had to be hospital after surgery in your country? 2. Did you get some irradiation after surgery? Or doctor made only surgery? Who decide this? 3. How quick they made new PSA test after surgery? Immediately? 4. What mean perineural invasion? Is this bad? May be the tumor can be advanced? They took 8 cores biopsy. 4 left and 4 right side. 3 shows some cancer. 1 right core has G 3+3=6 and perineural invasion symptoms and there is longer text, focus 0,8; 1,4 and 2mm. Something is positive colour? Second core has some little doctor text what I cant translate. There no G score appointed and third core has focus 0,8mm and G 3+3=6 Others are OK. Now I have to make some work so nice day!
